intro: Metaporana obtusa, commonly known as the broadleaf metaporana, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
